intro: Brassica campestris var. communis, commonly known as cabbage, is a biennial or annual plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stalks and tightly packed leaves that form a compact head. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and prefers cool climates with well-drained soil. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, while its seeds are small and black. Cabbage is a vital crop worldwide, valued for its nutritional content and culinary versatility.
